009package Ch02_HistogramsStatistics;
010
011import java.awt.Rectangle;
012
013import ij.IJ;
014import ij.ImagePlus;
015import ij.gui.Roi;
016import ij.plugin.filter.PlugInFilter;
017import ij.process.ByteProcessor;
018import ij.process.ImageProcessor;
019import imagingbook.common.image.IntegralImage;
020
021/**
022 * <p>This ImageJ plugin first calculates the integral image for the current
023 * image (8 bit grayscale only) and uses it to find the mean and variance
024 * inside the specified rectangle (ROI).
025 * Requires a rectangular ROI to be selected.
026 * See Sec. 2.8 of [1] for additional details.
027 * </p>
028 * <p>
029 * [1] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing - An Algorithmic Approach</em>,
030 * 3rd ed, Springer (2022).
031 * </p>
032 * 
033 *
034 * @author WB
035 * @see imagingbook.common.image.IntegralImage
036 */
037public class Integral_Image_GetRoiStatistics implements PlugInFilter {
038        
039        private ImagePlus im = null;
040
041        @Override
042        public int setup(String arg0, ImagePlus im) {
043                this.im = im;
044                return DOES_8G + ROI_REQUIRED + NO_CHANGES;
045        }
046
047        @Override
048        public void run(ImageProcessor ip) {
049                Roi roi = im.getRoi();
050                if (roi.getType() != Roi.RECTANGLE) {
051                        IJ.error("Rectangular selection required!");
052                        return;
053                }
054                
055                Rectangle rect = roi.getBounds();       
056                int u0 = rect.x;
057                int v0 = rect.y;
058                int u1 = u0 + rect.width - 1;
059                int v1 = v0 + rect.height - 1;
060                
061                IntegralImage iI = new IntegralImage((ByteProcessor) ip);
062                double mean = iI.getMean(u0, v0, u1, v1);
063                double var = iI.getVariance(u0, v0, u1, v1);
064                
065                IJ.log("ROI rectangle = " + rect);
066                IJ.log("ROI area = " + rect.width * rect.height);
067                IJ.log("ROI mean = " + String.format("%.3f", mean));
068                IJ.log("ROI variance = " + String.format("%.3f", var));
069                IJ.log("ROI stddev = " + String.format("%.3f", Math.sqrt(var)));
070
071        }
072}
